intro: Clerodendrum savanorum, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while its bark is smooth and grayish. Clerodendrum savanorum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks.
